meanings.definition: The quality of being pleasing to the ear.
meanings.sent1: The euphoniousnesses of the song brought a smile to her face.
meanings.sent2: The euphoniousnesses of the wind chimes filled the garden with joy.
meanings.sent3: The euphoniousnesses of the chirping birds made the grumpy old man hum along.
meanings.sent4: The euphoniousnesses of the flowing river was like a gentle lullaby to the tired hiker.
meanings.sent5: The euphoniousnesses of the violin solo echoed through the concert hall, captivating all listeners.

meanings.definition: The state of having a pleasant sound.
meanings.sent1: The euphoniousnesses of the laughter in the room was contagious.
meanings.sent2: The euphoniousnesses of the rain on the roof was soothing.
meanings.sent3: The euphoniousnesses of the cat's purring made the room feel cozy.
meanings.sent4: The euphoniousnesses of the waves crashing against the shore was like nature's symphony.
meanings.sent5: The euphoniousnesses of the children's voices playing outside filled the air with happiness.

meanings.sent1: The euphoniousnesses of the piano keys being played softly was enchanting.
meanings.sent2: The euphoniousnesses of the singer's voice was captivating.
meanings.sent3: The euphoniousnesses of the jingling bells made the holiday season feel magical.
meanings.sent4: The euphoniousnesses of the flute playing in the distance was like a sweet serenade.
meanings.sent5: The euphoniousnesses of the morning birdsong greeted the day with cheerfulness.
